questions.question: Russia was slow to do all of the following in he 19th century EXCEPT
questions.explanation: Russia was slow to industrialize, but it was not slow to promote economic growth because it did so by supporting entrepreneurs with loans.

questions.question: TRUE or False: The Bolsheviks were the first example of communists running a large country.
questions.explanation: The Bolsheviks were the first example of communists running a large country, as they took over Russia in 1917.

questions.question: TRUE or FALSE: Sun Yat-sen had a long rule in China
questions.explanation: Sun Yat-sen did not have a long rule in China, as he was overthrown by Yuan Shikai.

questions.question: China faced all of the following DOMESTIC concerns in the 19th century EXCEPT
questions.explanation: China faced all of the following domestic concerns in the 19th century except for over taxation of citizens, because the government was not taxing citizens enough.
answers: Lack of government funds to build

questions.question: Sun Yat-sen believed in all of the following governing principles EXCEPT
questions.explanation: Sun Yat-sen believed in all of the following governing principles except for individual property ownership, because he believed in socialism.

questions.question: Which empire was referred to as "the sick man of Europe" due to its struggling exports and agricultural economy?
questions.explanation: The Ottoman Empire was referred to as "the sick man of Europe" due to its struggling exports and agricultural economy.

questions.question: The Ottoman Empire's secret alliance with _________________ led to the dismantling of the Ottoman Empire into smaller independent countries.
questions.explanation: The Ottoman Empire's secret alliance with Germany led to the dismantling of the Ottoman Empire into smaller independent countries.

questions.question: TRUE or FALSE: Porfirio Diaz put Francisco Madero, his competition for president in jail which contributed to the Mexican Revolution.
questions.explanation: Porfirio Diaz put Francisco Madero, his competition for president in jail which contributed to the Mexican Revolution.
